Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor's 11-pitch at-bat in the sixth inning, Lindor's game-tying homer, Jesse Winker's game-winning hit in the ninth, Jose Iglesias' RBI single in the ninth
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets needed a win to keep themselves from falling further back in the Wild Card race, Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets' win was a crucial one, Manager Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's ability to grind out at-bats and put pressure on the Diamondbacks, Jose Iglesias and Francisco Lindor shared their thoughts on the importance of putting the ball in play
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets took both the three-game set and the season series from the Diamondbacks, escaped their recent tour of National League West contenders with a winning record, and improved their Wild Card chances
Others: The Mets' schedule does grow easier over the next two weeks, beginning Friday against a historically bad White Sox team
